Entities.Name: Anatomy
Entities.Definition: An anatomical body part mentioned in the radiology report (e.g., lung, heart, diaphragm).
Entities.SampleData: The heart and [lungs] are normal in size.

Entities.Name: Observation: Definitely Present
Entities.Definition: A visual finding or diagnosis clearly affirmed to be present in the image (e.g., effusion, opacity).
Entities.SampleData: There is a [pleural effusion] in the left lung.

Entities.Name: Observation: Uncertain
Entities.Definition: A finding or diagnosis that is possibly or likely present, but uncertain (e.g., may represent pneumonia).

Entities.Name: Observation: Definitely Absent
Entities.Definition: A finding or diagnosis that is definitively negated or absent (e.g., no edema, without pneumothorax).

Dataset.Name: RadGraph
Dataset.Description: A dataset of chest X-ray radiology reports annotated for clinical entities and their relations using a novel schema.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Entities are annotated by board-certified radiologists using a schema centered on anatomical structures and observations with certainty levels. Relationships between entities follow directed links: 'Located At', 'Modify', and 'Suggestive Of'. Annotations were performed via the Datasaur.ai platform and confirmed through labeling pilots and quality control.
